chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin James VanEss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

with Work release, childcare release and counseling release

3:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin James VanEss appeared by phone.  Attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne appeared by phone for Kevin James VanEss. Defense moves to amend the no contact order to no violent or abusive contact w/victim 1 and the no contact w/children be vacated. Also vacate the GPS- residence restriction and remove the condition to pick up belongings w/police escort. Victim 1 has completed the ERD program. Victim speaks w/the Court. State objects to the motion to modify bond. Defendant to start counseling at Labor of Love. Per defendant and victim 1, there are no weapons in the household. Per Day Report, defendant is compliant. Court grants bond motion.
